content.raw: I remember there is a special flag [-DTIXML_USE_STL](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/pull-request/100/embed-a-copy-of-tinyxml-for-windows/diff#Lcmake/SearchForStuff.cmakeT40) that is included in Ubuntu as a patch to the header file. content.raw:
I talked with Brian, and I'm 90% sure we want this OFF. We are building Gazebo using `/Md`, which tells the compiler to use dynamic libraries.

I'll still try this with it set to ON....just need to wait for the compiler to finish.
content.html:
I talked with Brian, and I'm 90% sure we want this OFF. We are building Gazebo using /Md, which tells the compiler to use dynamic libraries.

I'll still try this with it set to ON....just need to wait for the compiler to finish.

content.raw:
It could be that we are mixing different things here:

* One is the [Runtime Windows library, handled using the `/Md` flag](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-US/en-en/library/2kzt1wy3.aspx?f=255&MSPPError=-2147217396) and in boost, the [flag is `Boost_USE_STATIC_RUNTIME`](http://www.cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/module/FindBoost.html).
* The other different thing is how we want MSVC to link against boost libraries, controlled by the flag in this PR `Boost_USE_STATIC_LIBS`.

I see no problem into choosing static or dynamic linking for boost, most of boost are just headers.
content.html:
It could be that we are mixing different things here:

  • One is the Runtime Windows library, handled using the /Md flag and in boost, the flag is Boost_USE_STATIC_RUNTIME.
  • The other different thing is how we want MSVC to link against boost libraries, controlled by the flag in this PR Boost_USE_STATIC_LIBS.

I see no problem into choosing static or dynamic linking for boost, most of boost are just headers.

content.raw:
This seems to me like we are using both, static and dynamic libs at the same time, which generates the duplicate symbol.

libboost_thread-vc120-mt-gd-1_56.lib is a static lib (no need for the DLL) 
boost_thread-vc120-mt-gd-1_56.lib is the import lib for the DLL

So probably a bug in our build system, but not under the scope of this PR.
content.html:
This seems to me like we are using both, static and dynamic libs at the same time, which generates the duplicate symbol.

libboost_thread-vc120-mt-gd-1_56.lib is a static lib (no need for the DLL) boost_thread-vc120-mt-gd-1_56.lib is the import lib for the DLL

So probably a bug in our build system, but not under the scope of this PR.
